content.description: Sit start with at the base of the southeast arete with a right heel hook. From there, climb the arete until reaching the knobs, and mantel onto the east-facing slab.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there is a rock near the topout fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the south side of Face's southeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand crimp on the horizontal seam and a good left hand sidepull-undercling. From there, make a few easy move up the dihedral, gain a good edge, connect with the arete, pull up the knob on the arete, and mantel onto the east-facing slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. Despite the rock near the problem's start, the landing is quite good.
content.location: It climbs the short dihedral on Face's south face.

content.description: I am not sure if it's been done, but I spent a little time cleaning and climbing a nice problem close to the parking lot. The crux for me seems to be getting to the pocket, it is probably harder if you're shorter and less so if you're taller. Hopefully the slopey crimp stays intact.
content.location: It is on the South, Southwest face of the boulder and climbs avoiding the arete and climbing directly up. Start matched on a rail with a right hand three finger pocket about 6 feet off ground. Find foot holds to grab a slopey crimp and then a good two finger pocket. Continue with better crimps afterwards to top out.
